member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadPanelBar
member.summary: A navigation control used for building collapsible side-menu systems and Outlook-type panels.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is used for displaying a list of items in a Silverlight application and is often used for building collapsible side-menu interfaces. The RadPanelBar control has the following features:

list.item: Databinding that allows the control to be populated from various data sources
Programmatic access to the RadPanelBar object model which allows developers to dynamically create PanelBars, populate them with items, and set their properties.
Customizable appearance through built-in or user-defined skins.
Enhanced accessibility by support for keyboard navigation.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is made up of a tree-like structure of items represented by RadPanelBarItem objects. Items at the first level (level 0) are called root items. An item that has a parent item is called a child item. All root items are stored in the Items collection. Child items are stored in a parent item's Items collection.

Each item has a Header and an Item property. The value of the Header property is always visible in the RadPanelBar control whenever a RadPanelBarItem is collapsed or expanded, while the Item property is used to store the actual content of the RadPanelBarItem i.e. what is visible when the RadPanelBarItem is expanded.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadPanelBarItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the RadPanelBar control.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is made up of items. Items which are immediate children of the PanelBar are root items. Items which are children of root items are child items.

An item usually stores data in two properties, the Header property and the Item property. The value of the Header property is always displayed in the RadPanelBar control, and the Item property property is used to store the actual content of the RadPanelBarItem and is visible only when the RadPanelBarItem is expanded.
To create panel items, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define items inline in your page or user control.
Use the constructor to dynamically create new instances of the RadPanelBarItem class. These items can then be added to the Items collection of another item or PanelBar.
Data bind the RadPanelBar control to a data source.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl
member.summary: A navigation control used to create tabbed interfaces.

remarks.para: The RadTabControl is used to create a list of tabs. The TabConstrol is and its default items are of type .

list.listheader: The TabControl supports the following features:
list.item: Customizable look through the theming mechanism.
Control over the position of the TabStrip relative to its content.
Ability to set the orientation of the items.
Multirow TabStrips can be created by setting the IsBreak property of an item.
The align of the tab rows can be changed.
Any content can be placed in the TabItem headers such as icons, buttons and multiline text.

member.name: E:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Fired when a tab is selected. This is a routed event.

remarks.para: The SelectionChanged event is fired whenever the currently selected tab changes (or when all tabs are deselected). The event would be triggered when the user selects a different tab or when the selected index or selected item change.
SelectionChanged is a routed event which means that you can handle the event in one of the parents of the TabControl as well.
Please note that the SelectedIndex might change without firing the SelectionChanged event, for example when items position before the selected item are removed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the align of the TabItems in the row - Left, Right, Center, Justify. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The Align property arranges the TabItems in the preferred way - Left, Right, Center or Justify.
If Align Justify is selected, the items would be scaled proportionally all the to fill the available space.

If not enough space is available (i.e. the desired width of the row of TabItems is more than the available space), then the TabItems are arranged as if "Justify" is chosen. Unlike the WPF TabControl behaviour the TabItems would not automatically move to the next row if there is not enough space, instead their width is reduced and parts of them can be clipped.
If you would like to create a multirow RadTabControl, please use the property of the RadTabItem
The default value is Left.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.AllTabsEqualHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all the present tabs have equal height. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The AllTabsEqualHeight property governs the arranging behaviour of the TabStrip when TabItems with different height are present.
If you have multiline TabItems for example, setting the property to True would ensure that all the TabItems have the same height.

Please note that the adjustment of height takes place on a row-per-row basis, i.e. in a two-row TabStrip the height of the TabItems would be equal to the height of the highest item in each row and might be different.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.BackgroundVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the Background of the TabControl.

remarks.para: This property gives you a quick way to change the visibility of the background without having to modify the ControlTemplate of the TabControl.
This property does not affect the visibility of the divider (the line between the items and the content). To change the divider, edit the appropriate Control Template.
The default value is Visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.TabOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the TabItems in the TabControl. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The TabOrientation property allows you to set the orientation of the TabItems.
The default value is Horizontal.

example.para: The following examples show how TabOrientation can be set:
example.code: <telerik:RadTabControl Padding="5,5,5,0" TabOrientation="Vertical"> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 1"/> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 2"/> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 3"/> </telerik:RadTabControl>
example.para: Please note that you need the telerik namesapce to be defined in your XAML.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.TabStripPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the TabStrip with regard to the content. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The TabStripPlacement property allows you to change where the TabStrip (i.e. the buttons) would appear relative to the content.

Please note that changing the TabStripPlacement of the TabControl internally changes the ControlTemplate of the TabItems. To acieve a consistent look when a custom theme is created, ControlTemplates for the four positions should be provied.
The default value is Top.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.TopTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template of the TabControl when the TabStripPlacement is set to top. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: There are four properties that set the templates of the TabControl: , , and . These templates will be used when the of the TabControl is changed. Please note that if these properties are set to null, the default templates will be used.
In order to set the templates for the TabItems, the respective RadTabItem properties can be used. If the TabItems are generated ( is used) the ItemContainerStyle can be used to set the templates.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.ReorderTabRows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the TabItem rows would be reordered when selected. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The ReorderTabRows property governs the behaviour of the TabItems when selected. Its effect can only be observed when more than one row of TabItems are present. Refer to for more information on how to create multirow TabStrips.

Setting the property to true would make the rows in the TabStrip change place so that the selected item is always in the row nearest to the presented content (i.e. the bottommost row in a Top position, the rightmost column in a Left position, etc.)
Please note that the index of each item remains the same even when reordered.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.SelectedContent
member.summary: Gets the content of the selected item. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The SelectedContent property returns the Content of the currently selected item.

Note that the property cannot be set. To change the Content of the TabControl change the currenly selected item. The Selected content can either be a visual or a data object. The content presenter in the ControlTemplate is bound to this property.
If no items are selected, the property would return null.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.SelectedContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets the content template of the currenly selected item. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The ContentTemplate property returns the ContentTemplate of the currently selected item.

Note that the property cannot be set. To change the ContentTemplate of the TabControl items, use the and properties if an has been provided. Alternatively the can be used to assign a template on a per-item basis.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item. The default value is -1 which means that no item is selected. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The SelectedIndex property is used to get or set the index of the selected item. Setting the property to -1 will deselect all items.

Please note that the selected index property can change even property remains the same. This can happen when items are inserted before the currently selected item. The same is true if items are removed.
To get the currently displayed content, use the property.
When no items are present, the default value is -1. If items are present by default the first item (with index 0) would be selected.

If you set the SelectedIndex to something less than -1, an exception will be thrown. Setting it to something greater than the current items count would not chnage the SelectedIndex and no exception will be thrown. If the SelectedIndex is not altered and enough new items are added, the SelectedIndex will automatically chnage to the greater value and the new item will be selected.
If a newly inserted has its property set to true, it would become the selected item.
To get the index of an item, use the method.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabControl.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the currenly selected item. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The SelectedItem property gets or sets the currently selected item. The item can be of any type, including
If you would like to retrieve the selected container, you can use the and methods to retrive the container.
If no item is selected, the property will return null.
If you would like to set a TabItem as selected before adding it to the TabControl, you can use the property of the .
Please note that setting the SelectedItem property to anything that is not contained in the Items of the control would not throw an exception and would not change the property.
To receive notifications when the selected item is changed, sign up for the event.

Please note the following precedence of selection: The last item (largest index) to have its IsSelected property set to true will be selected. If no such item exists, the SelectedIndex property will be considered. If it is not set, the first item (SelectedIndex = 0) will be selected.

example.para: In the following example the TopTemplate property of the TabItems is set excplicitly to completely replace the look of the control. The same effect can be acieved by setting the ItemContainerStyle property of the RadTabControl.
example.code: <telerik:RadTabControl x:Name="tabControl" Background="Orange"> <telerik:RadTabControl.Resources> <!--The Style can be placed in the Page or Apllication resources as well.--> <Style x:Key="TabItemStyle" TargetType="telerik:RadTabItem"> <Setter Property="TopTemplate"> <Setter.Value> <ControlTemplate TargetType="telerik:RadTabItem"> <Grid> <Border Background="{TemplateBinding Background}"> <!--The content of the TabItem button is its Header, binding is needed.--> <ContentControl Content="{TemplateBinding Header}" ContentTemplate="{TemplateBinding HeaderTemplate}" /> </Border> </Grid> </ControlTemplate> </Setter.Value> </Setter> </Style> </telerik:RadTabControl.Resources> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 1" Background="Red" Style="{StaticResource TabItemStyle}" Content="Tab 1 Content"/> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 2" Background="Blue" Style="{StaticResource TabItemStyle}" Content="Tab 2 Content"/> <telerik:RadTabItem Header="Tab 3" Background="Yellow" Style="{StaticResource TabItemStyle}" Content="Tab 3 Content" /> </telerik:RadTabControl>

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTabItem
member.summary: Represents a tab item, the default item of the RadTabControl.

remarks.para: The RadTabItem class is the default item of the . The TabItem appears in the TabStrip of the TabControl while the contents of its property are shown when the Tab is selected.
When tabs are inserted into the TabControl the last Tab to have its property set to true would be selected.
You can change the look of the Control by setting the Theme, Style or Control Tempalte properties. To change the look of all the TabItems in a TabControl, use the and
The RadTabItem is not meant to be used on its own but as item of the RadTabControl. The TabItems will be automatically created if other items are inserted in the RadTabControl.

list.listheader: The properties of the TabItem that affect the TabControl are:
list.item: property governs whether the next TabItems will be in a separate row.
property selects or deselectes the given item (shows and hides its content in the TabControl)
is the Content that is displayed in the content area of the TabControl when the item is selected.
is the ContentTemplate of the TabControl content area when the item is selected.

remarks.para: Please note that the TabStripPlacement and TabOrientation properties are set by the TabControl and as such are read-only.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTreeView
member.summary: A hierarchical control used to display a tree of items in a page.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is used to display a list of items. The RadTreeView control supports the following features:

list.item: Databinding that allows the control to be populated from various datasources.
Programmatic access to the RadTreeView object model which allows dynamic creation of treeviews, populating with items and customizing the behavior by various properties.
Customizable appearance through built-in or user-defined skins.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is made up of tree of items represented by objects. Items at the top level (level 0) are called root items. An item that has a parent item is called a child item. All root items are stored in the Items property of the RadTreeView control. Child items are stored in the Items property of their parent .
Each item has a and a Tag property. The value of the property is displayed in the RadTreeView control, while the Tag property is used to store any additional data about the item.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTreeView class.

member.summary: Search recursively in the tree to get an item container (RadTreeViewItem) for a particular data item.

example.code: RadTreeViewItem itemContainer = RadTreeView1.ContainerFromItemRecursive(myDataItem) as RadTreeViewItem;

member.param: The data item.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTreeViewItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is made up of items. Items which are immediate children of the treeview are root items. Items which are children of root items are child items.

An item usually stores data in two properties, the Header property and the Tag property. The value of the Header property is displayed in the RadTreeView control, and the Tag property is used to store additional data.
To create tree items, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define items inline in your page.
Data bind the RadTreeView control to a data source.
